title.narrative: 008 - BASIC ED

description.narrative: Primary/Secondary/ Alternative Delivery â€“ Enhanced coverage, quality, and inclusivity of child friendly teaching and environments in primary and secondary schools, including the provision of quality alternative education., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased number and proportion of children accessing and completing quality basic education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Primary/Secondary/ Alternative Delivery ? Enhanced coverage, quality, and inclusivity of child friendly teaching and environmentsin primary and secondary schools, including the provision of quality alternative education.

description.narrative: Coverage, quality and inclusivity of child-friendly teaching and environments in primary, secondary and alternative education were enhanced, reaching over 1.3 million primary and secondary (middle) school students (49 percent girls), in five target States as well as for 45,000 out-of-school children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:08/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of townships and states that have produced final Township Education Improvement Plans and State Education Improvement Plans according to the standards outlined in the TEIP manual
